revised_title: An Account of an Extraordinary Eruption of Water in Kildwick, Yorkshire
tldr: A vicar from Kildwick in Yorkshire reports an extraordinary eruption of water in June 1686, caused by a sudden overflow due to heavy rainfall and a visible opening in the rock. The event resulted in significant damage to the towns of Kettlewell and Starbotton, with houses demolished, families displaced, and a loss of thousands of pounds.
